se.starbox.models

Class SettingsModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.starbox.models.SettingsModel

  • public class SettingsModel
extends java.lang.Object
    Model for getting and changing local user settings. Keeps local variables and writes changes to UserSettings.xml.
    Author:
    Anders

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SettingsModel()
      Creates a new SettingsModel that immediately attempts to read from UserSettings.xml and populate local fields.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getDisplayName()
      Gets user's display name from UserSettings.xml
      java.lang.String getEmail()
      Gets user's email from UserSettings.xml
      int getIndexUpdateInterval()
      Gets user's index update interval (in seconds) from UserSettings.xml
      static java.lang.String getIP()
      Gets user's IP address and returns it as a String.
      java.lang.String getStarboxFolder()
      Gets starbox folder from UserSettings.xml
      void setDisplayName(java.lang.String displayName)
      Updates user's display name setting and writes to UserSettings.xml
      void setEmail(java.lang.String email)
      Updates user's email address and writes to UserSettings.xml
      void setIndexUpdateInterval(int seconds)
      Update's user's index update interval and writes to UserSettings.xml, also updates OpenPipeline job to use the new interval (not implemented yet)
      void setStarboxFolder(java.lang.String path)
      Updates user's starbox folder setting and writes to UserSettings.xml
      void shutDown()
      Shuts down program cleanly
      void updateIndex()
      Starts the OpenPipeline job to begin indexing the local Starbox folder.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • SettingsModel

        public SettingsModel()
        Creates a new SettingsModel that immediately attempts to read from UserSettings.xml and populate local fields. If UserSettings.xml does not exist, fields get default values as given by private constants in this class.

    • Method Detail

      • getIP

        public static java.lang.String getIP()
        Gets user's IP address and returns it as a String. First attempts to get the external IP via whatismyip.com, if this fails, it gets local IP. If both fail, returns null.
        Returns:
        The user's IP address (or null on failure)

      • updateIndex

        public void updateIndex()
        Starts the OpenPipeline job to begin indexing the local Starbox folder.

      • shutDown

        public void shutDown()
        Shuts down program cleanly

      • getStarboxFolder

        public java.lang.String getStarboxFolder()
        Gets starbox folder from UserSettings.xml
        Returns:
        The user's starbox folder as a String

      • getDisplayName

        public java.lang.String getDisplayName()
        Gets user's display name from UserSettings.xml
        Returns:
        The user's display name as a String

      • getEmail

        public java.lang.String getEmail()
        Gets user's email from UserSettings.xml
        Returns:
        The user's email as a String

      • getIndexUpdateInterval

        public int getIndexUpdateInterval()
        Gets user's index update interval (in seconds) from UserSettings.xml
        Returns:
        The number of seconds between each interval as an integer value

      • setStarboxFolder

        public void setStarboxFolder(java.lang.String path)
        Updates user's starbox folder setting and writes to UserSettings.xml
        Parameters:
        path - The new starbox folder as a String

      • setDisplayName

        public void setDisplayName(java.lang.String displayName)
        Updates user's display name setting and writes to UserSettings.xml
        Parameters:
        displayName - The new display name as a String

      • setEmail

        public void setEmail(java.lang.String email)
        Updates user's email address and writes to UserSettings.xml
        Parameters:
        email - The new email as a String

      • setIndexUpdateInterval

        public void setIndexUpdateInterval(int seconds)
        Update's user's index update interval and writes to UserSettings.xml, also updates OpenPipeline job to use the new interval (not implemented yet)
        Parameters:
        seconds - The new interval in seconds as an integer
